meanings.definition: The quality or state of being unforgiving.
meanings.sent1: Her unforgivingness towards her friend's mistake caused a rift in their relationship.
meanings.sent2: His unforgivingness made it hard for him to move on from past grievances.
meanings.sent3: The unforgivingness of the teacher's grading system left the students feeling discouraged.
meanings.sent4: The unforgivingness of time never allows us to undo our past actions.
meanings.sent5: The unforgivingness of the winter storm left the town covered in a blanket of snow.

meanings.sent1: The unforgivingness of the judge led to a harsh sentence for the defendant.
meanings.sent2: Her unforgivingness towards her sister's apology strained their relationship further.
meanings.sent3: The unforgivingness of the cat towards the new puppy was evident in her hissing.
meanings.sent4: The unforgivingness of the mountain's terrain made it a challenging climb for even experienced hikers.
meanings.sent5: The unforgivingness of the desert sun made it essential to carry enough water on the journey.
